derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English sceorf, from the base of sceorfan 'gnaw', sceorfian 'cut to shreds'

means.word_mean: 1. (botany) a covering that resembles scales or bran that covers some plant parts
2. a thin flake of dead epidermis shed from the surface of the skin
